weaponProfile.title: Widowmaker
weaponProfile.specialAbility: A charged shot fires both barrels at once with massive armor penetration and a wider spread.

manufacturingIntel.creator: Darra Polytechnic (Artisan Division)
manufacturingIntel.creatorReputation: Darra Polytechnic is known for producing reliable, no-frills firearms. The 'Widowmaker' line was an experimental passion project, an attempt to fuse classic, handcrafted shotgun design with modern tech weaponry. They wanted to create a gun for the discerning merc who appreciates the feel of polished wood and engraved steel but demands the performance of a cutting-edge railgun.
manufacturingIntel.developmentHistory: The design is based on a classic over-under shotgun, prized for its balance and reliability. The innovation came from replacing the standard firing mechanism with a compact, electromagnetic charging system. This allows the user to fire standard shells or to hold the trigger, charging both barrels to launch the projectiles at hypersonic speeds. The result is a weapon that functions as a reliable CQC tool and a devastating, short-range anti-cover weapon. It became a cult favorite among tech-savvy solos and collectors.

strengths: Extremely versatile; functions as both a standard Power shotgun and a cover-penetrating Tech weapon.
The charged shot is capable of eliminating multiple, tightly-packed enemies through thin walls.
High burst damage makes it devastating in close-quarters ambushes.
Faster reload speed than most pump-action or drum-fed shotguns.
weaknesses: Limited to two shots before a mandatory reload, punishing missed shots.
The charged shot has a significant delay, requiring a pre-calculated attack.
The wider spread on the charged shot makes it less effective against single targets at medium range.
Loud and flashy, making it unsuitable for stealth.
tacticalAssessment.masteryArchetype: A 'Combat Tactician' build. A merc with a high Technical Ability attribute who uses their knowledge of the environment to their advantage. The ideal user doesn't charge into a room; they ping their enemies, see them through the walls, and use the Widowmaker's charged shot to eliminate them before the fight even begins. They are a master of ambush and surprise.

acquisitionIntel.marketAvailability: Rare, but obtainable. The Widowmaker is a high-end, specialist weapon. It can be found at upscale weapon vendors in City Center and Japantown. It is also a known favorite of combat-oriented Nomads, and can sometimes be purchased from their traveling caravans.
acquisitionIntel.rumoredLocation: Nash, a high-ranking member of the Raffen Shiv, is said to carry a heavily modified Widowmaker with a custom stock and an overclocked charging coil. He was last seen running a smuggling operation out of a cave system in the eastern Badlands.

fieldTestimonials.feedback: 'This gun is just plain smart. Ping the floor above me, see three Valentinos hiding behind a sofa. Charge up the Widowmaker, aim at the floor, and... *thump-thump*. Problem solved. No need to even kick down the door. It's the most efficient tool I own.'

fieldTestimonials.context: Open firefight in an Arasaka plaza.
fieldTestimonials.feedback: 'It's a beautiful gun, but two shots is just not enough. By the time I've reloaded, I've already taken a face full of lead from some corpo with a standard assault rifle. It's a great ambush weapon, but in a straight-up, prolonged fight, it leaves you hanging.'

'I got this from Nash. It's a work of art. The kick is satisfying, and the sound of a charged shot punching through a shipping container to flatline the guy on the other side... it never gets old. It's a thinking person's shotgun.'
